meanings.sent1: The history book mentioned a famous caesar who ruled Rome.
meanings.sent2: The caesar was known for his power and authority in ancient times.
meanings.sent3: At the toga party, everyone wanted to be the caesar for the night.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a caesar, commanding attention wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The statue of the caesar stood tall in the center of the city, a symbol of strength.

meanings.definition: A salad typically made with romaine lettuce, croutons, Parmesan cheese, lemon juice, olive oil, egg, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, and black pepper.
meanings.sent1: For lunch, she ordered a caesar with extra dressing on the side.
meanings.sent2: The caesar salad is a popular choice on the menu at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the caesar salad was so good, it should be called the 'king of salads'.
meanings.sent4: The flavors in the caesar danced on her taste buds like a culinary masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The fresh crunch of the croutons added a delightful texture to the caesar.

meanings.definition: A type of haircut with short, straight-cut bangs and hair that is longer on the sides and back.
meanings.sent1: She decided to try a new look and opted for a stylish caesar haircut.
meanings.sent2: The barber recommended a caesar style to enhance his features.
meanings.sent3: His friends teased him, saying the caesar haircut made him look like a young scholar.
meanings.sent4: The caesar haircut framed her face elegantly, drawing attention to her eyes.
meanings.sent5: With the caesar haircut, he felt confident and ready to take on the world.
